SEARCH
Module brickGame
Package brickGame.Controller

Class GameEngine

java.lang.Object
brickGame.Controller.GameEngine
public class GameEngine extends Object
The GameEngine class manages the game loop and provides hooks for various game-related actions. It includes separate timelines for updating, physics calculations, and time tracking.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    GameEngine.OnAction
    The OnAction interface defines callback methods for various game-related actions.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameEngine()
    Creates a new GameEngine with a default frames-per-second value of 60.

    Checks if the game engine is currently running.

    pause()
    Pauses the game engine, halting the update, physics, and time loops.
    void
    resume()
    Resumes the game engine after being paused, restarting the update, physics, and time loops.

    Starts the game engine, initializing the game and beginning the update, physics, and time loops.

    Stops the game engine, halting the update, physics, and time loops.

    • setFps

      public void setFps(int fps)
      Sets the frames per second (fps) for the game loop.
      Parameters:
      fps - The desired frames per second.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the game engine, initializing the game and beginning the update, physics, and time loops.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the game engine, halting the update, physics, and time loops.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Pauses the game engine, halting the update, physics, and time loops.

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Resumes the game engine after being paused, restarting the update, physics, and time loops.

    • isRunning

      public boolean isRunning()
      Checks if the game engine is currently running.
      Returns:
      true if the game engine is running; false otherwise.
